bibl.title: Expense Account for Camp Lazear, by Jefferson Randolph Kean, [1901]

div1.p: This report details the expenses of Camp Lazear.

div1.head: Expense Account for Camp Lazear, by Jefferson Randolph Kean, [1901]
div1.p:
The following are notations from the check book of Major Jefferson R. Kean, who
took over the burden of managing the account of the funds allotted by General
Leonard Wood for Walter Reed and his experimental yellow fever camp - Camp Lazear.
The checks are on the North American Trust Company of Cuba, Treasury Department
Island of Cuba.

The first check is numbered 131601, dated November - 1900; the last one used is
numbered 131694, dated December 3, 1901. In other words, the account ran about
thirteen months and involved 94 checks. The following running account will
have the checks numbered serially, 1, 2, 3, etc., instead of 131601, 131602, etc.

1. (131601) - Nov. - 1900, Subsistence Exp., San. Camp, Cash $ 20.00
2. (131602) - Nov. 24, 1900, Payroll & cash, Experimental
Sanitary Camp (Cash $26) 200.00
3. (131603) - Nov. 30, 1900, Benito Alvarez & Co, Mercadero 16 1/2
Wire gauze 12.72
4. (131604) - Dec. 3, 1900, Knight & Wall Co., San Pedro 28,
Hardware for bldgs. at Exp. San. Camp 56.27
5. - Dec. 4, 1900, Swift & Co., meat 16.11
6. - Dec. 5, 1900, E. B. Curtis, Services, carpenter 80.50
7. - Dec. 5, 1900, Harry Austin, services 25.00
8. - Dec. 5, 1900, James Airth, services 25.00
